conclusion: Determine the propagation time of light a in the water mist hemisphere.
The angle between light a and the interface is 30 degrees; the angle between light b and the normal is 45 degrees.
The angle of incidence for light a is 60 degrees.
Snell's Law: n1 sin(theta_i) = n2 sin(theta_r).
Using Snell's Law for light a: (sqrt(3)/2) = n2 sin(theta_r).
Refractive index of light b (n2) is sqrt(2).
For light b: sin(theta_r) = 1/2, so theta_r = 30 degrees.
The optical path inside the hemisphere is s = 2r.
The speed of light v in the medium is given by v = c/n2.
The speed of light in the medium is v = c/sqrt(2).
The propagation time t is given by t = s/v.
The propagation time of light a in the water mist hemisphere is (2r sqrt(2))/c.
